events.name: Azure Backup and Site Recovery
events.description: In this second meetup for Azure we'll be exploring backup and site recovery concepts with other available options that can be leveraged through Azure's 3rd party marketplace offering.• Azure Backup• Azure Site Recovery• Veeam Cloud Connect Azure (with rhipe Partner Enablement Specialist, Nick Tan)• Azure Security Center overview

events.name: 2018 Informatics Academy Course Preview Sessions
events.description:
Preview for Tech Degree, Advanced Diploma and Diploma Courses
Interested in advancing your prospects in the tech scene but not sure how? Come join us for our free preview sessions to find out more about how an education in tech can boost your employability across multi-faceted sectors!
This is an eventbrite page with multiple course preview dates. Please ensure that you choose the correct dates to RSVP from this page by selecting the correct dates from the blue box on the top right hand corner.
Course Preview Dates:

More about our courses:
Oxford Brookes University Courses
Find out more about how you can earn a top up degree awarded by Oxford Brookes University, ranked in the top 50 young universities in the world by QS World University Rankings 2018.

Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Computer Science (Top Up)
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Network Computing (Top Up)
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Computer Games and Animation (Top Up)

IT Pathway Courses
Discover our wide range of courses to suit your educational needs, from diplomas, advanced diplomas and degrees awarded by Informatics Academy, NCC Education and Oxford Brookes University. 

IT & Computing Courses
Networking Computing Courses
Business IT Courses

Gaming and Animation Courses
With gaming and animation now in demand, why not join one of the few established institutions who offer this course to distinguish yourself with a more specialized degree. 

Gaming and Animation Courses

To Sign Up
Course Preview sessions are totally free, so feel free to join us for any of the dates. Simply RSVP to the dates you want through this eventbrite page! On the blue box in the top right corner, select the date you intend to go for. The page will take a while to reload. After that, on the same right hand corner, click the green "Register" box, fill up the form, and you're done!
events.location: National Library Building, 100 Victoria Street, #13-01, Singapore 188064

events.name: Quantum Computing Meetup
events.description: Hello Quantumers! Our third Meetup is on Wednesday April 18th from 7:00 - 10:00pm. It will be located at Hospoda Microbrewery in 180 Albert Street (Albert Court) #01-19. The closest MRT station is Rochor (downtown line, 300m, 5 min walk). Alternative MRT stations are Little India (7 mins) and Bugis (10 mins). The folks at Hospoda (www.facebook.com/hospodamicrobrewery) have been very kind to offer to host our second meetup. They are one of the few microbreweries in Singapore, and will offer their local craft beer to us at happy hour prices for the duration of the event. Finger food is available onsite, while meals can be purchased from neighbouring eateries, and can be taken to Hospoda. There has been exciting news in the recent weeks about quantum computing, so do come down and join us for a great discussion! Bring your curiosity, and do not worry if you are not an expert. There is no need to know anything about quantum physics, so don't be shy :)
events.location: Hospoda Microbrewery, 180 Albert Street (Albert Court) #01-19, Singapore

events.name: DevSecOps In Practice
events.description: Software development is pressed for faster and faster release cycles with acceptable quality, budget and security. As movements like CI, CD and Devops aim to cut down on release cycles, it's security's job to help control the risk. The risk landscape is complex as modern development practices increasingly consume more and more third party code. Traditional methods do not cut it anymore - it's time for DevSecOps. This session gives an overview of how companies have implemented DevSecOps practices in their own delivery pipelines and how this can help increase developer awareness of risks affecting them. We'll walk an example CICD Pipeline and explore how security has been embedded as a part of it, how the movement is shaping up and how standards are starting to follow suite. Speaker: Cameron TownsendCameron Townshend Bsc, MSysDev, MCP CP Snr, MCSD - has extensive experience building large mission critical applications. Initial project lead on NSW Biosecurity Information System. Developed the WeatherChannel.com.au website. This site won 2010 Kentico site of the year for Integration and 2011 Astra award for Most Outstanding Use of Technology. He is both a hands-on developer and a skilled communicator and leader of project teams.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616
